===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ほとけ}}
Unclear. The ''hoto'' element might be from a Chinese dialect variation on {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ぶつ}} {{m|zh|佛陀|tr=bjut dhɑ}},<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> or possibly just the {{m|zh|佛|tr=bjut}} portion,<ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> ultimately deriving from {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=ぶつ}} {{m|sa|बुद्ध}}. The ''ke'' element might be the suffix {{m|ja|気|tr=ke||spirit}}.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ほとけ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ほとけ|kyu=佛}}

# A [[Buddha]]: an [[enlightened]] or [[awakened]] [[sentient]] being.
# A [[statue]] or [[image]] of any Buddha.
# The [[deceased]], a [[departed]] [[soul]].
# A term that a parent calls a child expressing parental affection: "my dear".
#* c. 890: [[w:Taketori Monogatari|Taketori Monogatari]]<ref name="Taketori">{{cite-book
|last=Horiuchi
|first=Hideaki
|coauthors=Ken Akiyama
|title=[[w:Taketori Monogatari|Taketori Monogatari]] , [[w:Ise Monogatari|Ise Monogatari]]
|publisher=[[w:Iwanami Shoten Publishing|Iwanami Shoten]]
|year=1997
|location=Tōkyō
|isbn=4-00-240017-4
}}</ref> (page 7)
#*: {{lang|ja|我子の'''佛'''、變化の人と申しながら、こゝら大さまで養ひ奉る志疎かならず。}}
#*:: {{lang|ja|わ が こ の '''ほとけ'''、 へんげ の ひと と まうしながら、 ここら おほき さま で やしなひ たてまつる こころざし をろか ならず。}}
#*:: ''Wa ga ko no '''hotoke''', henge no hito to maushinagara, kokora ohoki sama de yashinahi tatematsuru kokorozashi woroka narazu.''
#*::: My '''dear''' child, when you are talking about someone who is a manifestation [of a supernatural entity], it would not be dumb to try to bring them up in this grand fashion.
#* c. 890: [[w:Taketori Monogatari|Taketori Monogatari]]<ref name="Taketori"/> (page 61)
#*: {{lang|ja|あが'''仏'''、何事思ひたまふぞ。}}
#*:: {{lang|ja|あ が '''ほとけ'''、 なにごと おもひたまふ ぞ。}}
#*:: ''A ga '''hotoke''', nanigoto omohitamafu zo.''
#*::: My '''dear''', what on earth are you thinking about?
